types.name: Date
types.description: The `Date` scalar type represents a year, month and day in accordance with the [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) standard.

types.name: DateTime
types.description: The `DateTime` scalar type represents a date and time. `DateTime` expects timestamps to be formatted in accordance with the [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) standard.

types.name: DateTimeOffset
types.description: The `DateTimeOffset` scalar type represents a date, time and offset from UTC. `DateTimeOffset` expects timestamps to be formatted in accordance with the [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) standard.

types.name: Seconds
types.description: The `Seconds` scalar type represents a period of time represented as the total number of seconds.

types.name: Milliseconds
types.description: The `Milliseconds` scalar type represents a period of time represented as the total number of milliseconds.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server supports subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given __Type is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object.  `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface.  `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union.  `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an num.  `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object.  `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list.  `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null.  `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

args.name: format
args.description: .NET GUID format to use. N = short id, B = long id, etc.

fields.name: sectionSortOrder
fields.description: The sorting order defined for the section.

fields.name: shared
fields.description: Boolean value indicating whether the field is shared among all languages and all numbered versions.

fields.name: sortOrder
fields.description: The sorting order defined for the field.

fields.name: source
fields.description: The full path to the source of the field.

fields.name: unversioned
fields.description: A boolean value indicating whether the field is unversioned.

args.name: format
args.description: .NET GUID format to use. N = short id, B = long id, etc.

fields.name: jsonValue
fields.description: Raw value serialized into JSON format. For example, for an image field, it contains image specific properties such as 'src' and 'alt'.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: When paginating forwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: fields
fields.description: The list of the template fields, including inherited fields.

args.name: format
args.description: .NET GUID format to use. N = short id, B = long id, etc.

fields.name: ownFields
fields.description: The list of template fields defined for this template (not inherited).

fields.name: hostName
fields.description: The host name of the item’s site, as resolved during export.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The URL path of the item (without scheme and domain name).

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: The scheme (http or https) of the item’s site, as resolved during export.

fields.name: siteName
fields.description: The name of the resolved site of the item.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The full URL of the item, as resolved during export.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: A mapping of the englishName to the nativeName. For example, 'Spanish (Argentina) : español (Argentina)'.

fields.name: englishName
fields.description: The name of the language in English.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The language and locale. For example, 'es-AR'.

fields.name: nativeName
fields.description: The native name of the language.

args.name: hasLayout
args.description: If set to true, only items with presentation details are returned. If set to false, only items without presentation are returned. If not set, all items are returned.

args.name: includeTemplateIDs
args.description: Only consider items with these template IDs.

args.name: hasLayout
args.description: If set to true, only items with presentation details are returned. If set to false, only items without presentation are returned. If not set, all items are returned.

args.name: includeTemplateIDs
args.description: Only consider items with these template IDs.

args.name: first
args.description: Limits the results to the first n children. Use with 'after' for pagination.

args.name: after
args.description: Cursor value. Use with 'first' for pagination.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: The display name of the item.

fields.name: field
fields.description: Single field by name or ID.

args.name: name
args.description: The name or ID of the field.

args.name: ownFields
args.description: If true, returns the fields defined for the item template (not inherited from template ancestors).

fields.name: hasChildren
fields.description: Indicates whether the item has children.

args.name: hasLayout
args.description: If set to true, only items with presentation details are returned. If set to false, only items without presentation are returned. If not set, all items are returned.

args.name: includeTemplateIDs
args.description: Only consider items with these template IDs.

args.name: format
args.description: .NET GUID format to use. N = short id, B = long id, etc.

fields.name: languages
fields.description: Item information for every language defined for the item.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The full path of the item in the content tree.

fields.name: version
fields.description: The newest version of the item.

args.name: format
args.description: .NET GUID format to use. N = short id, B = long id, etc.

fields.name: jsonValue
fields.description: Raw value serialized into JSON format. For example, for an image field, it contains image specific properties such as 'src' and 'alt'.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the name-value pair.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the name-value pair.

args.name: format
args.description: .NET GUID format to use. N = short id, B = long id, etc.

fields.name: jsonValue
fields.description: Raw value serialized into JSON format. For example, for an image field, it contains image specific properties such as 'src' and 'alt'.

fields.name: values
fields.description: The key-value pairs in this field.

fields.name: count
fields.description: The number of items that this field references.

args.name: format
args.description: .NET GUID format to use. N = short id, B = long id, etc.

fields.name: jsonValue
fields.description: Raw value serialized into JSON format. For example, for an image field, it contains image specific properties such as 'src' and 'alt'.

fields.name: targetIds
fields.description: The IDs of the referenced items.

fields.name: targetItems
fields.description: The item(s) that this field references.

args.name: format
args.description: .NET GUID format to use. N = short id, B = long id, etc.

fields.name: jsonValue
fields.description: Raw value serialized into JSON format. For example, for an image field, it contains image specific properties such as 'src' and 'alt'.

fields.name: targetId
fields.description: The item ID that this field references.

args.name: format
args.description: .NET GUID format to use. N = short id, B = long id, etc.

fields.name: targetItem
fields.description: The item that this field references.

fields.name: anchor
fields.description: The anchor name this link points to (for example, #foo).

fields.name: className
fields.description: The CSS class on this link.

args.name: format
args.description: .NET GUID format to use. N = short id, B = long id, etc.

fields.name: jsonValue
fields.description: Raw value serialized into JSON format. For example, for an image field, it contains image specific properties such as 'src' and 'alt'.

fields.name: linkType
fields.description: The type of link this is (for example, 'external').

fields.name: queryString
fields.description: The query string on this link.

fields.name: target
fields.description: The HTML target attribute of the link (for example, __blank).

fields.name: targetItem
fields.description: The internal item that this link targets (null for external or other link types).

fields.name: text
fields.description: The body text of the link.

args.name: format
args.description: .NET GUID format to use. N = short id, B = long id, etc.

fields.name: jsonValue
fields.description: Raw value serialized into JSON format. For example, for an image field, it contains image specific properties such as 'src' and 'alt'.

fields.name: alt
fields.description: The alternate text for the image.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the media item.

fields.name: extension
fields.description: The extension of the media item (for example, 'jpg', 'gif').

fields.name: height
fields.description: Height of the image at full size.

args.name: format
args.description: .NET GUID format to use. N = short id, B = long id, etc.

fields.name: jsonValue
fields.description: Raw value serialized into JSON format. For example, for an image field, it contains image specific properties such as 'src' and 'alt'.

fields.name: keywords
fields.description: The keywords of the media item.

fields.name: mimeType
fields.description: The MIME type of the media item (for example, 'image/jpeg').

fields.name: size
fields.description: The size, in bytes, of the media item.

fields.name: src
fields.description: The URL to the media item.

args.name: maxWidth
args.description: The max width of the resulting image in px (server rescaled if needed) - Note: Size requested must be on whitelist.

args.name: maxHeight
args.description: The max height of the resulting image in px (server rescaled if needed) - Note: Size requested must be on whitelist.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the media item.

fields.name: width
fields.description: Width of the image at full size.

args.name: format
args.description: .NET GUID format to use. N = short id, B = long id, etc.

fields.name: jsonValue
fields.description: Raw value serialized into JSON format. For example, for an image field, it contains image specific properties such as 'src' and 'alt'.

fields.name: key
fields.description: The key of the key-value pair.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the key-value pair.

fields.name: routePath
fields.description: The route path for a specific language.

fields.name: results
fields.description: All site routes for a specific language.

fields.name: total
fields.description: Total number of routes for the site in a specific language.

fields.name: notFoundPage
fields.description: Item representing the notFound page path.

fields.name: notFoundPagePath
fields.description: The path to redirect to, if a page is not found.

fields.name: serverErrorPage
fields.description: Item representing the serverError page path.

fields.name: serverErrorPagePath
fields.description: The path to redirect to, if a generic error occurs.

fields.name: isQueryStringPreserved
fields.description: Information about whether the query string is preserved upon redirect.

fields.name: locale
fields.description: Language name that should match request locale (used only for redirect items).

fields.name: pattern
fields.description: The pattern to get paths by and apply redirection to.

fields.name: errorHandling
fields.description: Error handling information for the site.

args.name: language
args.description: The site language to request.

fields.name: hostname
fields.description: The configured host name attribute of the site.

fields.name: redirects
fields.description: Information about redirect rules for the site.

fields.name: robots
fields.description: Information about the URLs search engine crawlers can/are allowed to access on the site.

fields.name: rootPath
fields.description: The content path of the root item of the site.

fields.name: routes
fields.description: Routes for the site in a specific language.

args.name: language
args.description: The site language to request.

args.name: includedPaths
args.description: Paths to include in the routes result.

args.name: excludedPaths
args.description: Paths to exclude from the routes result.

args.name: after
args.description: Cursor value. Use with 'first' for pagination.

args.name: first
args.description: Limits the results to the first n routes. Use with 'after' for pagination.

fields.name: sitemap
fields.description: List of urls to sitemap.xml media items.

args.name: site
args.description: The site name to request.

fields.name: siteInfoCollection
fields.description: Basic information about available content sites.

fields.name: item
fields.description: Item for getting presentation details/layout data.

types.name: UnknownItem
types.description: Represents a Sitecore item whose template is not included in the schema. If you receive results of this type, consider expanding your included templates.

fields.name: field
fields.description: Single field by name or ID.

args.name: name
args.description: The name or ID of the field.

args.name: ownFields
args.description: If true, returns the fields defined for the item template (not inherited from template ancestors).

fields.name: hasChildren
fields.description: Indicates whether the item has children.

args.name: hasLayout
args.description: If set to true, only items with presentation details are returned. If set to false, only items without presentation are returned. If not set, all items are returned.

args.name: includeTemplateIDs
args.description: Only consider items with these template IDs.

args.name: format
args.description: .NET GUID format to use. N = short id, B = long id, etc.

fields.description: Item information for every language defined for the item.

args.name: format

fields.name: jsonValue
fields.description: Raw value serialized into JSON format. For example, for an image field, it contains image specific properties such as 'src' and 'alt'.

fields.name: numberValue
fields.description: The field's value as a floating-point number.

args.name: format
args.description: .NET GUID format to use. N = short id, B = long id, etc.

fields.name: intValue
fields.description: The field's value as an integer.

fields.name: jsonValue
fields.description: Raw value serialized into JSON format. For example, for an image field, it contains image specific properties such as 'src' and 'alt'.

fields.name: dateValue
fields.description: The field's value as a UTC epoch date suitable for constructing a Javascript Date.

fields.name: formattedDateValue
fields.description: The field's value as a preformatted date.

args.name: format
args.description: A .NET-style date formatting string to format the date with.

args.name: offset
args.description: The offset from UTC to format the time with, in minutes. Can be used with JS' getTimezoneOffset() to format local times using the browser's configured timezone.

args.name: format
args.description: .NET GUID format to use. N = short id, B = long id, etc.

fields.name: jsonValue
fields.description: Raw value serialized into JSON format. For example, for an image field, it contains image specific properties such as 'src' and 'alt'.

fields.name: item
fields.description: Allows querying for information about an item in the content tree.

args.name: path
args.description: The path or ID of the item.

args.name: language
args.description: The item language (defaults to the default language).

fields.name: layout
fields.description: Allows querying presentation details/layout data for the item.

args.name: site
args.description: The site name.

args.name: routePath
args.description: The route path.

args.name: language
args.description: The language code, for example, 'en' or 'en-US'.

fields.name: search
fields.description: Allows querying for items based on provided criteria.

args.name: where
args.description: Predicate used for the search.

args.name: after
args.description: Cursor value. Use with 'first' for pagination.

args.name: first
args.description: Limits the results to the first n items. Use with 'after' for pagination.

args.name: orderBy
args.description: Sorting criteria used for the search result.

fields.name: site
fields.description: Allows querying for information about content sites.

inputFields.name: operator
inputFields.description: A predicate (for example, EQ, CONTAINS, NCONTAINS or NEQ).

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the field to use for sorting.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the 'if' argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the 'if' argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
